result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D. Lathen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Scott D. Lathen was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott D. Lathen is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Scott D. Lathen was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Scott D. Lathen was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Simon O, Vicki G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers. No victims present. DE's mother, fiance, friend present in court. Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:   946 -   Victim rights compliance. Sentence recommendations. 
Ct1:   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. 3 days sentence credit if revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered.  Restitution of $4937.09 is disputed by DE. Hearing to be held before Court Commissioner - date TBD and clerk to notify by mail. Voters rights, FIrearms warning, Appeal rights given. 
Ct4:   Court orders a $100 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or civil judgment. DNA surcharge for Ct4 is waived.
Unsigned Restitution Orders
Notice and Motion for Restitution Order ($4,817.09)  kmk
Presentence Investigation ordered.
Juror question
Juror questions
Ct4 - guilty
Ct3 - not guilty
Ct2 - not guilty
Ct1 - guilty

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  822 - Court holds discussion re: exhibits, instructions, verdict forms outside the presence of the jury. Jury brought in at 8:40am.

DAY 2:  Trial resumes with closing arguments. Jurors instructed on principals of law. Alternate juror excused at 9:58am. Bailiffs sworn. Jurors begin deliberations at 10:00am. Jurors return with verdict at 10:59am. Verdict: Ct1 - guilty, Ct2 - not guilty, Ct3 - not guilty, Ct4 - guilty. Jurors polled. Jurors released at 11:04. Atty Fields-Bowers moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict on Cts 1, 4 - denied. ST moves for judgment on the verdict as to Cts 1, 4 - granted. DE found guilty of Cts 1, 4 by the court. Court orders Cts 2, 3 dismissed on not guilty verdict. PSI ordered. ST does not move to revoke bond. Bond conditions continue as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Exhibits S1-S11 and D12-D17 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 5/27/16. vm
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 901 - Preliminary instructions reviewed outside the presence of the jury. Witnesses sequestered. ST stipulates to DE's use of photos. Prior convictions of witnesses stipulated by all parties.  Jury brought in. (Court reporter changed at noon. 37 for a.m. and 21 for p.m.**)   ** a.m. court reporter - Darlene Shue; p.m. court reporter Tracy Czarnecki-Kozmer - KZ

DAY 1: Jury sworn and pre-instructions given. Opening statements. State presents case. Jurors provided with note-taking materials. Witnesses sworn and testified: PPPD Officer D. Andrews, Vicki G., Simon O., PPPD Officer P. Gainer, . Exhibits #D12-D17 offered, rec'd by the court and published for the jury. Jurors released for lunch at 11:30am. Court holds individual voir dire with juror re: employment at location where incident occurred. Parties satisfied with juror's impartiality. Trial resumes at 1:05pm. Exhibits #S1-S11 offered, rec'd by the court and published for the jury. State rests. Outside the presence of the jury, Atty Fields-Bowers moves for dismissal. Discussion held. Court finds that there is sufficient evidence presented thus far for the trial to continue to the jury. Motion for dismissal is denied. Defense presents case. Witnesses sworn and testified: Rosie S., Scott Lathen. Defense rests. Rebuttal witness recalled - previously sworn: PPPD Officer P. Gainer. Rebuttal testimony concluded. Jurors released at 3:05pm. Atty Fields-Bowers moves for dismissal at the close of all evidence. Discussion held. Court denies motion to dismiss. Instruction conference held. Trial to resume with closing arguments at 8:30 on 5/25/16.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury Selection and Peremptory Challenges list

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers. Atty Ben Schwarz appears for observation of voir dire only.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  956 - Parties are prepared to proceed. One alternate to be impaneled. No further motions to be heard. Jurors sworn and pre-instructed on principals of law. Voir dire begins at 10:18 - completed at 11:10am. Jury of 13 impaneled - to be sworn upon return 5/24/16. Unselected jurors are released at 11:21am. Parties are satisfied with the jury as selected. Discussion held re: preliminary instructions, juror notes, and witness questioning. Trial to commence 5/24.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty James Fields-Bowers.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  855 - JT to be rescheduled due to ongoing jury trial with higher priority case.  Jury selection scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE does not appear. Atty Lauren Breckenfelder appears on behalf of Atty Komp.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  936 - DE was made aware that this case would likely be bumped. Court takes no action on non-appearance.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  DE appears in person with Atty Angela Komp.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1106 -   State is compliant with victim rights notification. JT is adjourned by court due to calendar constraints. Subpoena for Rosie S. is continued to new date.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Matt. Perz. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek. Def. rejects offer and it is withdrawn by State. PPPD Off. Derrick Andrews sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Perz. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, the repeater allegations on all counts are struck. Plea of not guilty entered. Judicial pretrial on 3-12-14 @ 3:30pm. Bond continued.
